name: Teriyaki Tofu
description: This teriyaki tofu makes a delicious and easy weeknight dinner. You will love the crispy baked tofu in a sweet and salty homemade teriyaki sauce. So much better than takeout!
recipeIngredient: 14 oz very firm or extra-firm tofu
3 tablespoons mirin or rice wine vinegar

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350 °F. Cut the tofu into cubes and put it in a bowl. Add two tablespoons of corn starch.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat your oven to 350 °F. Cut the tofu into cubes and put it in a bowl. Add two tablespoons of corn starch.

recipeInstructions.text: Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch.
recipeInstructions.name: Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the tofu cubes on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the tofu cubes on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the broccoli into florets and cook or steam it. I like mine still a bit crunchy and not too soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the broccoli into florets and cook or steam it. I like mine still a bit crunchy and not too soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce: Place all of the ingredients into a sauce pan and cook for 3-4 minutes on medium heat until the sauce becomes thick and sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce: Place all of the ingredients into a sauce pan and cook for 3-4 minutes on medium heat until the sauce becomes thick and sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the baked tofu cubes and stir well. Serve over brown rice and add the broccoli as a side. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and freshly chopped green onion. Enjoy!
